   18: %% %CopyrightEnd%
   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Test encode/decode of dictionary-related modules. Each test case
   23: %% runs multiple tests in parallel since many of the tests are just
   24: %% the same code with different in-data: implementing each test as a
   25: %% single testcase would make for much duplication with ct's current
   26: %% requirement of one function per testcase.
   27: %%
   28: 
   29: -module(diameter_codec_SUITE).
   30: 
   31: %% testcases, no common_test dependency
   32: -export([run/0,
   33:          run/1]).
   34: 
   35: %% common_test wrapping
   36: -export([suite/0,
   37:          all/0,
   38:          base/1,
   39:          gen/1,
   40:          lib/1,
   41:          unknown/1,
   42:          recode/1]).
   43: 
   44: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter.hrl").
   45: 
   46: -define(util, diameter_util).
   47: -define(L, atom_to_list).
   48: 
   49: %% ===========================================================================
   50: 
   51: suite() ->
   52:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 15}}].
   53: 
   54: all() ->
   55:     [base, gen, lib, unknown, recode].
   56: 
   57: base(_Config) ->
   58:     run(base).
   59: 
   60: gen(_Config) ->
   61:     run(gen).
   62: 
   63: lib(_Config) ->
   64:     run(lib).
   65: 
   66: unknown(Config) ->
   67:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
   68:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
   69:     unknown(Priv, Data).
   70: 
   71: recode(_Config) ->
   72:     run(recode).
   73: 
   74: %% ===========================================================================
   75: 
   76: %% run/0
   77: 
   78: run() ->
   79:     run(all()).
   80: 
   81: %% run/1
   82: 
   83: run(base) ->
   84:     diameter_codec_test:base();
   85: 
   86: run(gen) ->
   87:     [{application, diameter, App}] = diameter_util:consult(diameter, app),
   88:     {modules, Ms} = lists:keyfind(modules, 1, App),
   89:     [_|_] = Gs = lists:filter(fun(M) ->
   90:                                       lists:prefix("diameter_gen_", ?L(M))
   91:                               end,
   92:                               Ms),
   93:     lists:foreach(fun diameter_codec_test:gen/1, Gs);
   94: 
   95: run(lib) ->
   96:     diameter_codec_test:lib();
   97: 
   98: %% Have a separate AVP dictionary just to exercise more code.
   99: run(unknown) ->
  100:     PD = ?util:mktemp("diameter_codec"),
  101:     DD = filename:join([code:lib_dir(diameter),
  102:                         "test",
  103:                         "diameter_codec_SUITE_data"]),
  104:     try
  105:         unknown(PD, DD)
  106:     after
  107:         file:del_dir_r(PD)
  108:     end;
  109: 
  110: run(success) ->
  111:     success();
  112: 
  113: run(grouped_error) ->
  114:     grouped_error();
  115: 
  116: run(failed_error) ->
  117:     failed_error();
  118: 
  119: run(recode) ->
  120:     ok = diameter:start(),
  121:     try
  122:         ?util:run([{?MODULE, run, [F]} || F  <- [success,
  123:                                                  grouped_error,
  124:                                                  failed_error]])
  125:     after
  126:         ok = diameter:stop()
  127:     end;
  128: 
  129: run(List) ->
  130:     ?util:run([{{?MODULE, run, [F]}, 10000} || F <- List]).
  131: 
  132: %% ===========================================================================
  133: 
  134: unknown(Priv, Data) ->
  135:     ok = make(Data, "recv.dia", Priv),
  136:     ok = make(Data, "avps.dia", Priv),
  137:     {ok, _, _} = compile(Priv, "diameter_test_avps.erl"),
  138:     ok = make(Data, "send.dia", Priv),
  139:     {ok, _, _} = compile(Priv, "diameter_test_send.erl"),
  140:     {ok, _, _} = compile(Priv, "diameter_test_recv.erl"),
  141:     {ok, _, _} = compile(Priv,
  142:                          filename:join([Data, "diameter_test_unknown.erl"]),
  143:                          [{i, Priv}]),
  144:     diameter_test_unknown:run().
  145: 
  146: make(Dir, File, Out) ->
  147:     diameter_make:codec(filename:join(Dir, File), [{outdir, Out}]).
  148: 
  149: compile(Dir, File) ->
  150:     compile(Dir, File, []).
  151: 
  152: compile(Dir, File, Opts) ->
  153:     compile:file(filename:join(Dir, File), [return | Opts]).
  154: 
  155: %% ===========================================================================
  156: 
  157: %% Ensure a Grouped AVP is represented by a list in the avps field.
  158: success() ->
  159:     Avps = [{295, <<1:32>>},  %% Termination-Cause
  160:             {284, [{280, "Proxy-Host"}, %% Proxy-Info
  161:                    {33, "Proxy-State"}, %%
  162:                    {295, <<2:32>>}]}],  %% Termination-Cause
  163:     #diameter_packet{avps = [#diameter_avp{code = 295,
  164:                                            value = 1,
  165:                                            data = <<1:32>>},
  166:                              [#diameter_avp{code = 284},
  167:                               #diameter_avp{code = 280},
  168:                               #diameter_avp{code = 33},
  169:                               #diameter_avp{code = 295,
  170:                                             value = 2,
  171:                                             data = <<2:32>>}]],
  172:                      errors = []}
  173:         = str(repkg(str(Avps))).
  174: 
  175: %% ===========================================================================
  176: 
  177: %% Ensure a Grouped AVP is represented by a list in the avps field
  178: %% even in the case of a decode error on a component AVP.
  179: grouped_error() ->
  180:     Avps = [{295, <<1:32>>},  %% Termination-Cause
  181:             {284, [{295, <<0:32>>},      %% Proxy-Info, Termination-Cause
  182:                    {280, "Proxy-Host"},
  183:                    {33, "Proxy-State"}]}],
  184:     #diameter_packet{avps = [#diameter_avp{code = 295,
  185:                                            value = 1,
  186:                                            data = <<1:32>>},
  187:                              [#diameter_avp{code = 284},
  188:                               #diameter_avp{code = 295,
  189:                                             value = undefined,
  190:                                             data = <<0:32>>},
  191:                               #diameter_avp{code = 280},
  192:                               #diameter_avp{code = 33}]],
  193:                      errors = [{5004, #diameter_avp{code = 284}}]}
  194:         = str(repkg(str(Avps))).
  195: 
  196: %% ===========================================================================
  197: 
  198: %% Ensure that a failed decode in Failed-AVP is acceptable, and that
  199: %% the component AVPs are decoded if possible.
  200: failed_error() ->
  201:     Avps = [{279, [{295, <<0:32>>},    %% Failed-AVP, Termination-Cause
  202:                    {258, <<1:32>>},             %% Auth-Application-Id
  203:                    {284, [{280, "Proxy-Host"},  %% Proxy-Info
  204:                           {33, "Proxy-State"},
  205:                           {295, <<0:32>>},      %% Termination-Cause, invalid
  206:                           {258, <<2:32>>}]}]}], %% Auth-Application-Id
  207:     #diameter_packet{avps = [[#diameter_avp{code = 279},
  208:                               #diameter_avp{code = 295,
  209:                                             value = undefined,
  210:                                             data = <<0:32>>},
  211:                               #diameter_avp{code = 258,
  212:                                             value = 1,
  213:                                             data = <<1:32>>},
  214:                               [#diameter_avp{code = 284},
  215:                                #diameter_avp{code = 280},
  216:                                #diameter_avp{code = 33},
  217:                                #diameter_avp{code = 295,
  218:                                              value = undefined},
  219:                                #diameter_avp{code = 258,
  220:                                              value = 2,
  221:                                              data = <<2:32>>}]]],
  222:                      errors = []}
  223:         = sta(repkg(sta(Avps))).
  224: 
  225: %% ===========================================================================
  226: 
  227: %% str/1
  228: 
  229: str(#diameter_packet{avps = [#diameter_avp{code = 263},
  230:                              #diameter_avp{code = 264},
  231:                              #diameter_avp{code = 296},
  232:                              #diameter_avp{code = 283},
  233:                              #diameter_avp{code = 258,
  234:                                            value = 0}
  235:                              | T]}
  236:     = Pkt) ->
  237:     Pkt#diameter_packet{avps = T};
  238: 
  239: str(Avps) ->
  240:     OH = "diameter.erlang.org",
  241:     OR = "erlang.org",
  242:     DR = "example.com",
  243:     Sid = "diameter.erlang.org;123;456",
  244: 
  245:     [#diameter_header{version = 1,
  246:                       cmd_code = 275,  %% STR
  247:                       is_request = true,
  248:                       application_id = 0,
  249:                       hop_by_hop_id = 17,
  250:                       end_to_end_id = 42,
  251:                       is_proxiable = false,
  252:                       is_error = false,
  253:                       is_retransmitted = false}
  254:      | avp([{263, Sid},  %% Session-Id
  255:             {264, OH},   %% Origin-Host
  256:             {296, OR},   %% Origin-Realm
  257:             {283, DR},   %% Destination-Realm
  258:             {258, <<0:32>>}]  %% Auth-Application-Id
  259:            ++ Avps)].
  260: 
  261: %% sta/1
  262: 
  263: sta(#diameter_packet{avps = [#diameter_avp{code = 263},
  264:                              #diameter_avp{code = 268},
  265:                              #diameter_avp{code = 264},
  266:                              #diameter_avp{code = 296},
  267:                              #diameter_avp{code = 278,
  268:                                            value = 4}
  269:                              | T]}
  270:     = Pkt) ->
  271:     Pkt#diameter_packet{avps = T};
  272: 
  273: sta(Avps) ->
  274:     OH = "diameter.erlang.org",
  275:     OR = "erlang.org",
  276:     Sid = "diameter.erlang.org;123;456",
  277: 
  278:     [#diameter_header{version = 1,
  279:                       cmd_code = 275,  %% STA
  280:                       is_request = false,
  281:                       application_id = 0,
  282:                       hop_by_hop_id = 17,
  283:                       end_to_end_id = 42,
  284:                       is_proxiable = false,
  285:                       is_error = false,
  286:                       is_retransmitted = false}
  287:      | avp([{263, Sid},         %% Session-Id
  288:             {268, <<2002:32>>}, %% Result-Code
  289:             {264, OH},          %% Origin-Host
  290:             {296, OR},          %% Origin-Realm
  291:             {278, <<4:32>>}]    %% Origin-State-Id
  292:            ++ Avps)].
  293: 
  294: avp({Code, Data}) ->
  295:     #diameter_avp{code = Code,
  296:                   data = avp(Data)};
  297: 
  298: avp(#diameter_avp{} = A) ->
  299:     A;
  300: 
  301: avp([{_,_} | _] = Avps) ->
  302:     lists:map(fun avp/1, Avps);
  303: 
  304: avp(V) ->
  305:     V.
  306: 
  307: %% repkg/1
  308: 
  309: repkg(Msg) ->
  310:     recode(Msg, diameter_gen_base_rfc6733).
  311: 
  312: recode(#diameter_packet{} = Pkt, Dict) ->
  313:     diameter_codec:decode(Dict, opts(Dict), diameter_codec:encode(Dict, Pkt));
  314: 
  315: recode(Msg, Dict) ->
  316:     recode(#diameter_packet{msg = Msg}, Dict).
  317: 
  318: opts(Mod) ->
  319:     #{app_dictionary => Mod,
  320:       decode_format => record,
  321:       string_decode => false,
  322:       strict_mbit => true,
  323:       rfc => 6733,
  324:       failed_avp => false}.
